output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of motion graphics principles and software. You're now equipped to create engaging animations and visual effects for various applications. Continue practicing and exploring advanced techniques to further enhance your skills.
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of Motion Graphics! This course is designed for absolute beginners with no prior experience. We'll cover the fundamental principles and techniques to create captivating animations and visual effects. Get ready to bring your ideas to life!

chapters.description: Introduction to motion graphics, its applications, and how it differs from animation and video editing. Understanding the core concepts and terminology.
A brief overview of Adobe After Effects interface, tools, and panels. Setting up a new project and understanding the basic workflow.
Exploring the key animation principles like timing, spacing, easing, and anticipation. Applying these principles to create realistic and engaging motion.
Understanding layers and their properties. Arranging, grouping, and manipulating layers to create complex compositions.
Animating the basic transform properties (position, scale, rotation) using keyframes. Creating simple animations using these properties.
Navigating the timeline, creating keyframes, and adjusting animation speed. Understanding the importance of keyframe interpolation.

modules.moduleTitle: Fundamentals of Animation in After Effects

chapters.description: Creating and formatting text layers. Animating text properties like position, opacity, and character spacing.

chapters.chapterTitle: Shape Layers and Basic Vector Graphics
chapters.description: Creating and manipulating shape layers. Animating shape properties to create dynamic vector graphics.
Importing Illustrator or Photoshop files into After Effects. Animating imported graphics and integrating them into your motion graphics projects.
Applying basic effects and presets to enhance your animations. Experimenting with different effects to achieve desired results.
Understanding different export settings and formats. Optimizing your motion graphics for various platforms (web, social media, etc.).
Tips for organizing your projects, optimizing performance, and creating visually appealing motion graphics. Resources for further learning and inspiration.
